1
DAZ: Take caution as you walk on the ice, my love. Here it is: another <color=orange>orcnid</color> has become entrapped in this tangle of bramble vines after visiting the surface.
2
1
CASSAVA: Thank goodness you were able to spot its distress in time! Now, do I recall you mentioning <color=orange>a new invention</color> that might make our task of freeing it less treacherous?
3
2
DAZ: Indeed! While in this state, the orcnid's apphendages fold in an unfavorable position that proves impossible to safely approach. My new invention should insulate this danger! I am eager to show it to you in my <color=orange>workshop,</color> my love!
4 2
DAZ: But the orcnid will waste no time slipping back under the current after being released.. Before we release it, I would like to quickly inspect its interior cavity for stowaways; I have found <color=orange>scrolls</color> lodged inside these poor creatures before.
5 4
CASSAVA: I must remind the others to keep their scrolls and stones well-kept so they will not be swept away into the waves by the cyclones... Both for the orcnids' safety, and as a sign of respect to your craft!
